title: Unpopular Opinion: Adellaideskyhartï»¿ shouldn't be banned, nor should he be punished at all.

embed.description: Riot Games says they will perma ban Highest Mastery Points Singed, AdellaideSkyhart if he continues to play Support Smite Singed due to it negatively effected his team mates. He has been reported a number of times because of his non-meta playstyle. Do you think he deserves to be perma banned or even constantly suspended?

body:
From Riot's Acceptable Behavior page:
https://s21.postimg.org/cmum9olwn/Untitled.png

The rest of the argument is in the video I've linked. In a nutshell, don't ban someone for not sticking to the meta. What alternative has Riot given for someone who wishes to play like this? None. Punishing him is wrong and shows the exact reason why so many people have been leaving this game.

replies.body:
This is all a matter of perspective. 

When you hear the story, you are hearing that he got banned BECAUSE he played Singed support. 

In reality he got banned because of the fact that he consistently forced Singed support on his teammates despite their objections. 

Furthermore, the way he played those matches was so unconventional that his teammates were unable to adapt to the strategy, and most often left his ADC extremely vulnerable in a 1v2 lane. This crippled the bot lane and put his team behind, often with a loss of first blood and first tower, giving the enemy team a fed ADC and support. 

So it was not the fact that he played Singed support. He could have played the lane conventionally and everything would have been just fine. 

And it doesn't even matter that it was an off-meta champion. If he refused to play support as anyone other than Lulu, who is definitely accepted as a support, he is limiting his teams ability to form an effective strategy. 

Also, if he had picked a conventional support and decided to play in the same way, he would also be creating a poor experience. 

The fact that he intentionally and consistently repeated this behavior, even after having been temporarily suspended by Riot in attempt to get him to stop, is why he was banned.

"In reality he got banned because of the fact that he consistently forced Singed support on his teammates despite their objections. " Am I allowed to report teammates who play Yasuo despite my objections? Because if I can get every Yasuo main banned I'll gladly accept the tradeoff.

I'm literally going to copy paste the comment that I just made to someone else who made a similar suggestion because I really don't feel like typing it again. 

You can report me for anything you like. Riot reviews reports for validity. If you say that I picked something that you didn't like they will most likely disregard it, but if you and the entire team is trying to organize a strategy and I am simply refusing to work with you because I want to play this champion at all costs, they will probably consider it to at least have merit. But one, or four, .. hell even if all nine other players in that match report you for a single match for this, this report alone would not be enough for Riot to consider you to be a problem. Getting this sort of report for similar behavior over many games will absolutely result in action.

So you are right, "creating a poor experience" can mean anything to anyone. But it says quite a lot to that he is creating a poor experience to many people over many matches with the same behavior.

Riot made it very clear when they released the new champ select that if you refuse to play the lane you have been assigned by the system, and your team is not ok with you playing a different lane than your assigned one, the that is bannable. If riot did not enforce the lanes they assign to people, then the new champ select would be meaningless as you'd still have people arguing over lanes and locking into a lane by pick order. 

This guy queues up as botlane support, get's assigned the botlane support role, and then goes and does a double jungle instead. If he talks to his team and they say 'ok, we are comfortable with you not going to your assigned lane (such as in the case of a lane swap or something)' then it would be fine, but they are not ok with it for obvious reasons and by deciding to not go to his assigned lane despite their protests he is in violation of the lane assignment rules of new champ select.

End of story, this isn't a meta enforcement issue its an issue of him breaking the rules regarding playing your assigned lane.

By the sounds of it, the problem was talking *at* his team rather than *with* his team, combined with it causing ripple effects in his own team (Singed takes ally jungle, which puts Jungler behind, so Jungler leaches off of Mid, which puts Mid behind, then Singed takes blue when Jungler was going to give it to mid, etc.)

Riot did say that he shouldn't get permabanned for this though (that part of the notice was a big mistake by the support person handling it), but that he should try to work with his team more, helping them understand it.

I got to admit after thinking about it for a while i can understand why people would want him banned!

He is constantly creating "negative experiences" for other players! Mainly for the ADC and the enemy jungler (imagine you are the one getting invaded... by a singed... I for example would hate that)
And you are basicly supposed to not do anything that creates those... including not feeding, flaming, blaming, not-warding, not-building-meta, not-playing-meta... etc.

But lets be honest compared to what he does, flaming and raging is far worse in regards to that.
Well you can brush flaming and raging aside as "just having a bad game" and say that he is doing it on purpose... but i doubt both of these parts!

I don't want to say what he is doing is right... but at least it's not entirely wrong!
Since he seems to be trying to communicate AND is doing something that helps his team (you can't say that about 80% of the players in Gold/Plat).
PLUS he actually does what his role should be supposed to do... SUPPORT (his team). It's calles support for a reason and not ADSitter or WardDobby... 

I rather have HIM on my team than 80% of the ADCs I meet in Gold/Plat (yes as a S3-S5 support i hate those to the bone)!


If that guy gets banned... I don't know... probably have a "negative experience" regarding league i guess... and be pissed!
